716744f.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716744f.text:
The Bowery, north from Canal Street and viewing towards the Grand Street station. A similar view to this appears in K4ng's Handbook of New York of 1893 (published in 1897)-pege 841.
1884
Gift Thru New York Historical Society

716736f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716736f-a.text:
Bowery, west side, south from Canal, to, but not including Bayard Streets. The view shows the Thalia Theatre, (46-48 BEwery) and
Atlantic Gardens, adjoining it on the north.
May 25, 1904.
Brown Brothers.
The same, at a later date and showing the Thalia Theatre in a state of collapse. Also shown is the Citisens Saving Bank, replacing the forner building on the corner. It the foreground, a portion of the Manhattan Bridge Plazs, erection of which necessitated a structual change in the Third Ave., Elevated.
December 26, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

717999f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery
717999f-a.text:
Canal Street, at the S.W. corner of the Bowery. Building shown in the process of erection, is the Citizen's Savings Bank.
About 1920.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

716742f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716742f-a.text:
(1)
Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Canal Street. (street level not shown). The view shows a portion of the Canal Sgreet
Station of the Third Ave., Elevated.
October 11, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same and including a limited view northward. In the foreground
appears a portion of Manhattan Bridge Plaza.
June, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

716742f-b.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716742f-b.text:
(1)
Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Canal Street. (street level not shown). The view shows a portion of the Canal Sgreet
Station of the Third Ave., Elevated.

716741f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716741f-a.text:
The Bowery, west side, south from but not including Canal Street. Also shown is a general view southwestward from the Manhattan Bridge Approach of the City Hall 2one skyline. Depicted prominently of which are the Singer, Municipal, Woolworth Buildings and the new County Court House. Tenement houses intervening between the fore and backoround comprise a locality known as Chinatown; of which the Thalia Theatre with the Atlantic Gardens adjoining (photo studio) was a well known land mark.
About 1927.
Ewing Galloway.

716743f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716743f-a.text:
(1)
Bowery, west side, north from but not including Canal Street. Canal Street, has been widened and the cigar store shown in the foreground, is on the N.W. corner.
August 30, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a frontal view of building's in the foreground of No. 1
August 30, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(3) The same, as No. 2 and showing a view further northward.
August 30, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

718000f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery
718000f-a.text:
Canal Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.w. corner of
the Bowery.
August 30, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

716740f-b.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716740f-b.text:
(1)
Bowery, West side, south from but not including Canal Street. The Atlantic Garden is shown with the Thalia Theatre adjoining.
June 25, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.
June 13, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
A view of the upper portions of buildings shown in 1 3 2, as seen from the Manhattan Bridge Plaza and across the Third Ave. Elevated structure.
June 13, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

717996f-b.text:
(1)
Canal Street, west from but not including the Bowery.
November 27, 1928.
PP L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing only the north side of the street.
February 2, 1929.
PP L. Aperr.
(3)
The same, the following year.
May 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

718001f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery
718001f-a.text:
Canal Street, north side, east from the Bowery. This view shows
the vehicular apnroach of the Manhattan Bridge.
April 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

717995f-a.text:
Canal Street, south side, west from but not including the Bowery,
July 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
717995f-a.folder: Canal Street & Bowery Street (West)., Manhattan, NY

717997f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Bowery
717997f-a.text:
Canal Street, south side, west from but not
including the Bowery.
July 9, 1932
P. L. Sperr, photographer

716737f-a.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716737f-a.text:
Bowery, west side, north from but not including Canal Street.
May 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg2E E220

716738f-b.title: Manhattan: Bowery - Canal Street
716738f-b.text:
(1)
Bowery, east side, north from Canal Street. Bales of paper stock shown in the foreground, are for the Jewish Press Publicatiot Co., who occupy Nos. 77-79 Bowery, adjoining the N.E. corner of Canal Street.
September 25, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same; slightly northward. Note the New Universal Motion Picture
Theatre, at the S.E. corner of Hester Street.
September 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
